website_summaries.verdict: With strong and classic construction, this case does exactly what it was designed to do at a great price.
pros: This is a great, sturdy hardshell case, made from plywood, that fits many different models
It has strong latches, smooth hinges, and a decent size accessory compartment
For a great price, it does exactly what it's meant to do
cons: Needs to air out a few chemical smells when you first get it home
The fit on a standard Fender-type guitar is not very snug
There may be room for your instrument to move a bit in transit

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, Sturdy Case!
customer_reviews.text: I've used a gig bag for the longest and desperately needed the upgrade. This is a great case for the money! It may be just plywood but it's a very sturdy build. The interior is black and very soft so it won't scratch you're guitar. It has a compartment inside for some accessories, smaller than I thought it would be but does the job. The latches work perfectly and it actually locks! However my guitar does move around inside but it's not harming anything...yet, for that I remove a star. Considering the price though, this is a great case that'd I'd recommend for occasional travel and to rehearsals.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary H.

customer_reviews.title: Guitar shaped box that only partially closes and has no handle.
customer_reviews.text: We've had this guitar case a little over a year. It was purchased to protect our guitar during a cross country move. So, obviously we don't carry it around everywhere taking it from place to place in order to play said guitar. One of the buckles has never closed all the way but our move was last minute so we didnt have time to return and get a replacement. The handle broke off yesterday. It has been picked up maybe half a dozen times? The guitar isn't made of concrete. If you need this for more than a safe place for your guitar to live I would recommend looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: A case of a great deal!
customer_reviews.text: i am primarily an acoustic guitarist, but I have a Vintage Summer of Love electric guitar that I use on some gigs. i have needed a case for it but have always put of buying one. Thankfully a friend pointed this one out to me. At the price i figured I couldn't lose; this offers quality well beyond the price. The guitar fits well, the case feels sturdy and secure, it is nicely balanced for carrying, and it looks professional. I wouldn't trust an airline with it, but it will be great for getting my guitar to gigs.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: Great Guitar AND Bass Cases at a perfect price
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a hard case online and there are quite a few out there that are very costly. Then I found this one priced at less than $70. Compared to the more costly ones, I wasn’t Expecting this to be anything more than a bedroom storage case. I was wrong in my assumptions. This case fits my Squire Jazz Bass perfectly. While I have yet to travel with it, it feels like it would do a great job protecting the bass as the build seems sturdy. I was so happy with this case I bought another one for my strat. I am very pleased so far with both purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Kelly (Sam T Wasteaway)

customer_reviews.title: Measurements are wrong
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case specifically because it was the only one I could find with an advertised inside length of 48", which is exactly how long my custom Bass is. Now that I received it I measured myself and it is only 46" inside length. My Bass doesn't fit! I come back online and see that in the last 2 days the description got changed to 47.25", which is still a lie but obviously I wasn't the first to complain. Also, the inside layout on the one I got sent is different than the one pictured Will work for a standard P-Bass but don't trust their measurements.
customer_reviews.author: Louis A Boertje

customer_reviews.title: Keep your expectations low
customer_reviews.text: This was the least expensive hard shell guitar case on Amazon and so I bought it. On the second day that I opened it, the strap that keeps the lid from falling completely back and open, pulled apart. I took off one star for that. I understand that the cheapest case will not be high quality. I can live without the strap. My main requirements were met: 1, My guitar fits. 2, It's protected. 3, The handle did not fall off.
customer_reviews.author: hangtime

customer_reviews.title: OK for the Money
customer_reviews.text: The quality is not great but just ok . You get what you pay for. I bought this to hold a tele style firefly. So no big deal. Cheap guitar, cheap case. I will use it mostly for jam sessions and open mikes to hold this guitar. The case lining is very thin and the picture shows rounded corners but the case I got has right angle corners. It's ok though. I am satisfied. Looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Carter

customer_reviews.title: Price is right
customer_reviews.text: Got my case today.. plenty of room for my EVH WOLFGANG STANDARD.. only issue I have is screw going from outside to inside storage case was not long enough..cause when I opened case up was not even screwed in.. no biggy, I have a longer s.s. screw and I just need it for storage..no more room on wall.. lol. Overall satisfied with the case for the $$.. can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Kowalczik

customer_reviews.title: Not a very good product
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how this case it rated so well. It was shipped on a thin cardboard box with only plastic bag and two strips of cardboard to keep it protected, so inevitably it got some shipping damage (see pictures above), which alone isn't to big of a deal to me. When I put my bass in the case and latch it closed, the latches pop open once I go to pick it up by the handle (see video). Inside the case there is a little bit of wiggle room, but I guess that is kindof expected for a cheap guitar case.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Nice fit and plenty of padding, but poor stability
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little torn about this case. The Pro Series case features are definitely a huge plus - the guitar (I used it with a Strat) fit like a glove, the guitar didn't move at all, which is always a good sign. The interior looks great and high end, too. However, the top was fairly fragile, easily bent/wobbled when open and even when shut, it would rock back and forth a bit. So - despite the great and snug fit of the guitar I don't have much confidence in the stability of this case and wouldn't take it on the road or (air) travel with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Biggest piece of crap ever
customer_reviews.text: Had the case for 5 minutes... This is the biggest piece of crap out there. Pay JUST A FEW more dollars and buy something worth having. This case is utter garbage. Case clasps pops open through bowing when a bass is placed inside. Storage compartment screw pops out because front of case (by clasps) bows and pulls the screw out. There are many good cases out there - this just isn't one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glad I took a chance on this! Great guitar case for the$$
customer_reviews.text: I needed a case for my $249.00 Squire Vintage Stratocaster that I happen to like very much. It was getting dusty on it's stand so I wanted a case. As much as I'd like a Fender case or Gator they were too expensive for this guitar. I bought this ChromaCast case and was stunned by how nice it is! Great construction, nice inside with good compartment. Not as plush as the more expensive models but it will get the job done. Latches work well, one is a little stiff but that's not a big deal. ChromaCast Badge is nice looking as is the material and stitching. I have confidence carrying my guitar around in this case and am very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wedero

customer_reviews.title: Fits Strat very snug and a great price too!
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Strat nice and snug. Got mine as “used” so it was discounted but was like new except for maybe some slight scuffs but it didn’t matter cause that’s what cases are for. I like the large storage area provided as well. I checked out their YouTube video before ordering and it was very informative. I had originally bought a gator case but didn’t like how my Strat wasn’t snug and slid around inside so I ordered this for half the price. Very happy and would recommend it. I appreciate Amazon for allowing me to return the Gator case and get this instead.
customer_reviews.author: Guitar Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Best buy for the money, if you're  on a Budget
customer_reviews.text: Stylish bass guitar case, spacious for any size 5 or 6 string bass...durability could come in question if you're securing a expensive bass guitar..construction is average, material used to construct this case consist, of cheap,easily torn material.. I obtained a small tear on the bottom base,of my case as i accidentally scraped the sidewalk walk testing the transport of the case....the inside of this case is nice and plush, with an additional storage cavity. Also the bass case I received was not the bass case shown on the Amazon website.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but not great
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It definitely works to protect your guitar. I have a Tele in it but the neck rest is not really deep enough to keep your guitar from sliding back and forth. Also, I wouldn't use this case on a plane if you plan on traveling with your guitar. It works for me though, going back and forth to the practice room or to shows.
customer_reviews.author: Cam B

customer_reviews.title: Received a different case, it’s crap.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several Chroma Cast cases over the last 6 months and usually, they’re very good. I don’t know if it’s the pandemic or what but I got a different model than pictured. I am not happy but I’m just too tired to deal with an exchange. I would otherwise be ok with the case if the interior materials weren’t such garbage. Cheap velvet, poor materials are not fit for carrying any prized guitar, cheap or otherwise. I’m going back to Gator cases where I know I get decent, affordable cases.
customer_reviews.author: Filipe N. Marques

customer_reviews.title: Better cases available in similar price ranges
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 3 different ChromaCast cases. The jumbo acoustic case was total junk and arrived with broken latches. I returned that one. I also bought 2 rectangular standard electric cases which were fine for a few weeks until the poorly glued black exterior started peeling off on both. They never even left my house! If you're on a budget you're better off with those Musician's Gear cases from MF & GC or just pay a little more for one of the many better alternatives on Amazon. I can personally recommend the Yaheetech standard electric and On-Stage bass case. For a little more you can even get a Gator.
customer_reviews.author: NY Groover

customer_reviews.title: Great value, versatile size.
customer_reviews.text: Great value for a hard case, holds lots of guitars, including jaguar, or even a Les Paul. Only issue is... that there's not enough padding, and some guitars might knock around if You don't add some additional support. Update: this case can hold a variety of guitars, including a jaguar, les Paul, Strat, Tele, and G&L fallout. As I mentioned previously, you may need to add some padding or a Velcro strap over the next report to stabilize the guitar. I also added a picture with a Epi SH inside.
customer_reviews.author: ux4484

customer_reviews.title: Good price and feels pretty solid
customer_reviews.text: It's not a molded ABS - SKB case, so have reasonable expectations. I ordered the bass version. My fender jazz bass and my fender P bass both fit if I remove the quick release strap locks i have on there. They don't move around inside the case either. It's definitely a few steps up from a gig bag in terms of protection, so I would recommend it for that. I can't really say I would recommend it for air travel or shipping. It may not hold up to that much abuse.
customer_reviews.author: DJP, PELS

customer_reviews.title: What a lovely mess
customer_reviews.text: Apparently Amazon singled out my original review because I was honest. My original review said nothing that had not already been said in other reviews. Censorship is fun. These cases are cheaply made and not worth a dime much less $60. Spend a little more and get something better. And don't hurt Amazon's feelings when reviewing one of their vendors.
customer_reviews.author: George N Root III

customer_reviews.title: Way nicer than it should be and lefty Jazzmaster approved.
customer_reviews.text: Just received my case and I'm more than satisfied. First of all, my lefty Squier Jazzmaster fits perfect. Second, instead of the case with the rounded edges that's pictured, the case I got was the more traditional style with the 90° edges that are "leather" bound, which I prefer (probably not real leather, but I'm not complaining). Inside, a lot of the surface is covered in a mix of velvet like material and plush material. Is it as nice as a case you get with a 2000 dollar guitar? Nope, but it is more than enough to keep your guitar safe around the house and for the occasional gig. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: D. S. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Case For The Money
customer_reviews.text: This is a review for the review for the Les Paul case. Overall this is a really nice case for the price. It is sturdy, looks good and is adequate padded to protect your guitar inside of it. There's room to store your tuners and picks but the guitar stays firmly in place inside when moving the case around. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Darren O'NeillTop Contributor: Classical Music

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Guitar Case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had a good experience with a ChromaCast Bass case. Case is well-made, sturdy, and has good quality fittings. It has four latches. One quibble, since I never lock my guitar case - the locking latch is not very secure as it can be opened using a paper clip, for example. It's more for securing the latch for travel than protecting from theft. My guitar fits beautifully without need for additional padding.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Newtron

customer_reviews.title: Wow Wow Wow!!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! OMG, I was not expecting to receive such a wonderful case for $59! The quality is outstanding. Excellent buckles, excellent soft interior, and one classy looking guitar case! Love the white stitching. Couldn’t be happier. I was in the guitar store yesterday and a gentleman was purchasing a hard guitar case for $129. It looked cheaper than this one, LOL . I had to tell him about this case and told him don’t waste his money on the more expensive case. So he didn’t buy it and is going to order this one instead! Wow, what more can I say! Thank you Chromecast!!!
customer_reviews.author: Horseygal

customer_reviews.title: Decent Case for the Price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this is a decent case. It is a little sloppy in the guitar fit, but that is probably to be expected for a general shape case. It seems fairly solid so far, but I can tell that the vinyl covering is likely to start peeling off at some point. Plenty of room to carry stuff (even a 15-foot cord and strap) in the internal compartment. Bottom Line: If you need an inexpensive hard case this will do, but I probably wouldn't recommend trusting it to your expensive prized possession.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Brodeur

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for SIXTY BUCKS!
customer_reviews.text: IT WAS SIXTY BUCKS! For this price it can not be beaten. I have a schecter stilleto five string bass and it is a larger bass. Fits in great. Yeah it is cheap. Better than a gig bag, but not the quality of my 160 dollar cases for my other instruments. I needed something to put my bass in to make sure my two toddlers do not mess with it. Perfect. 10/10 recommend for casual players or anyone not touring. To all the people complaining about scuffing or the quality of the felt... Again....... I can not stress this enough............IT WAS SIXTY BUCKS!
customer_reviews.author: Dorien Rose

customer_reviews.title: GREAT case for the money.
customer_reviews.text: These cases are very nice. They fit a good deal of guitars. I have 3 of them, one has a BC Rich Virgin in it, another has a US Handcrafted BC Rich Mockingbird in it and the last one has my 1 of a kind custom made Halo 7 string in it. They are luggage quality, though probably not luggage rated. I never have had a problem with these, and have had the first one over a year now. In the event I need another case and the item will fit in one of these, I'll be purchasing a 4th.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy

customer_reviews.title: What you see is not what you get
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time I've purchased a bass guitar case that is supposed to look like the one in the listing. Each of the three times I ordered from a different website , but Amazon did the order fulfillment. Each time I received a case that looks different than what is advertised. If you don't care about what you get as long as the your instrument fits then this case will probably be fine. But if you're particular about looks or design because, like me, you have multiple instruments and want to keep the them in visually distinct cases, then buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Guitar Hoarder

customer_reviews.title: So So Good and bad
customer_reviews.text: Better than a bag, worse than a serious hard shell case. For the price it does what you would expect, I just need them to transport my guitars when I move to another house so for that purpose it does the work, but the fact that I stacked 3 of them empty on top of each other and it left marks tells me they will not last long, don’t even think about traveling on an airplane with it, so it depends what you want it for.
customer_reviews.author: christy

customer_reviews.title: A cheap case to carry but not rely on
customer_reviews.text: Spacious but the padding is thin and materials flimsy. The locks are easy to close but too easy and could open accidentally if something knocked against them. The interior is spacious but the storage in the middle much smaller than these cases use to provide. The handle is fine. Stitching and stuff looks good but you can tell it will fray and look bad with useable. Use this to store a bass but don’t bring it to rough and ready gigs.
customer_reviews.author: Amia BooMaster

customer_reviews.title: First the good points, it arrived quickly
customer_reviews.text: First the good points, it arrived quickly, the price is good and at first it looks nice. Now the bad, my case arrived with entire front bottom seam curled away from the case and what seems to be glue still tacky under the curled out material. Along with that my Stratocaster would not lay flat in the case as if the neck support area is designed too high which will cause a lot of stress on the guitar neck and causes the headstock to push into the top of case. I was very disapointed especially since I purchased based on good reviews from others.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Prather

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I measured my Protégé by Cordoba classic guitar to ensure the guitar case would be the right size. The dimensions showed the case to leave a small amount of space around the guitar. When it arrived I could barely believe how perfectly it fit. I have to gently push the guitar down into the case to displace the air underneath. Absolutely perfect fit. I am very happy with the construction and appearance. I would recommend this case for a full size Protégé by Cordoba classical.
customer_reviews.author: Bob-WA

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing execution of a good design idea.
customer_reviews.text: Review is based on my experience with one case of Pro Series ($88.70) that I returned immediately after delivery. Good: Prompt delivery and packaging although thin was undamaged. Bad: Plywood used is weak making the whole case fragile. Hardware used is inferior for case in this price range. Locking latch is a joke that did not work. 'Plush' lining was thin with plywood showing through due to careless assembly. Overall: Terrible execution of what could have been (as described online) a good guitar case. Would not buy again (even at lower price) unless materials used and quality of assembly improves.
customer_reviews.author: V. Boucek

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Value, do not pass up
customer_reviews.text: Okay, well the case is awesome. Great material and structure. I have a squire bullet and it fits the guitar perfectly. Built in compartment holds all my pics, strap, extra strings, tuner, guitar tool and a 10 foot cable. So I am very impressed. So why only the 4 stars? Because the case hardware that snaps the case shut has key holes but I did not receive any keys in the package or case. Not a big deal, but if they are going to have locks, there should be keys. Great case
customer_reviews.author: JoshuaTX

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case for the price!
customer_reviews.text: After reading many of the reviews, some favorable, some not, I decided to order the ChromaCast case for my classical guitar...and I'm very glad I did! Unlike one of the other reviews who chose the Silver Creek case over this one, my experience as just the opposite, as the Silver Creek case had too many latches, didn't stay open, was a bit to snug for my guitar, and the top didn't close correctly, and returned it for this one. This is a good sturdy case with three latches, well made, a perfect fit my guitar, and a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Edmond M. Horowitz

customer_reviews.title: This is a good case, I took example pictures to show what it holds!
customer_reviews.text: It's actually bigger than people are saying in reviews. It holds a js dinky with plenty of extra room for a small bag at the headstock and the storage compartment is very nice. For the price, I'm buying 10 more of these. Good case, don't listen to anyone that said a Jackson soloist or dinky wouldn't fit. It even holds a 24 fret neck through BC Rich Mockingbird! It actually holds my kit warlock snug but well!
customer_reviews.author: mAnBaNaNnAsLaM

customer_reviews.title: Great case with a few issues
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case. Hard shell, went on a few trips and no damage to the Guitar, however, the case has shown a fair amount of damage. Dings and one of the metal casters popped off. I was extremely gentle with my use, but even then still damage. For the price, I would have hoped for a little better quality, but overall it did its job and my guitar had stayed safe and sound. The storage is amazing and the interior is so plush!
customer_reviews.author: jpmaes0622

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price
customer_reviews.text: Better for the price than I expected. The handle hardware is a bit flimsy, but the case materials pretty well assembled and pretty good overall. Snug fit for my telecaster, but body wise it fits. One thing that doesn’t fit however is the Bigsby tremolo, as it is too tall for the depth of the case, by a few mm. Not the end of the world though, especially given the price.
customer_reviews.author: Rabid Weasel

customer_reviews.title: Nice case
customer_reviews.text: I received the case and immediately looked it over for any of the issues I read in some other reviews. none were present. In fact, the build was really good and all of the hardware seems to be solid. I bought this for my Takamine GD51CE and it fit in the case nicely. The case has plenty of padding and a nice snug fit to hold the guitar in place. All in all, I am happy with the case.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly good build quality! Fits my guitar perfectly, nice and snug, Alvarez acoustic, maybe 4 inches extra space on top, and the shell case is looks great and seems solid. Bought this because I'm getting ready to move and wanted the guitar to be safe and secure. Like that it has 4 latches. And my Martin case only has 3! No complaints at all. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Fits Washburn HJ40SCE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Washburn HJ40SCE jumbo guitar and I love it. However, nobody had the hard case for it. I even ordered one from a Washburn dealer who assured me it would fit and when the case arrived it was the wrong size. So I measured the guitar twice and scoured Amazon and Reverb for a case, and this one had the right numbers and the right price - and it FITS. So if you're loving your jumbo Washburn and you need a safe place to keep it, don't hesitate.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Albert

customer_reviews.title: If you have a guitar that is even remotely decent and you don't have a hard shell case for it you would be doing that guitar a great Injustice not to order this case
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance and ordered this guitar case not expecting much... I will be ordering 6 more... If you have a guitar that is even remotely decent and you don't have a hard shell case for it you would be doing that guitar a great Injustice not to order this case... Or six of them LOL it's nothing I would trust an airline with but other than that basic gigging and Storage you couldn't ask for more for Less!
customer_reviews.author: Foxdieamazonion

customer_reviews.title: this item is EXCELLENT for ME
customer_reviews.text: now hear me out first, this item is EXCELLENT for ME!!! I have an odd guitar. now though it is shaped like a les paul it is not, far from it it does not fit in most hard shell cases but this one does, and it is beautiful great protection sung fit you can not go wrong. AND THE PRICE! come on, hey I'm not easy to please, but with this case I am pleased. strong, well fitted nice workmenship try it, you won't be disappointed. what you got to loose a couple of bucks
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It's a good, cheap case and it doesn't smell like glue, like my Gretsch case. I got one for a used Squire Strat, $60 at a pawn shop, I got a good, cheap ChromaCast case, and new tuners and bridge, and my vintage, alder-body Squire, in a nice case, a great working guitar, comes in under $150, whole thing, so I knew to go to ChromaCast for my new Alhambra 4Z classical. The new case fits my old Takemine Jasmine classical like a glove, unlike the Martin case it lives in. Just got in my Alhambra 4z, love it, fits in my new case -- happy as a clam.
customer_reviews.author: susanna

customer_reviews.title: Great case for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case for the casual musician. Overall I was really impressed with the build and feel. Obviously its a bargain price, so it's not the most robust case, but for light travel or just safer storage at home it's fantastic. If I were a touring musician I would probably go with something a little more sturdy. The handle mounts seem kind of thin, that's my only real concern. My Les Paul fits in it snugly, no rattle or jostling when carrying the case. This really is a great deal, but if you are a gigging musician, probably not for you.
customer_reviews.author: W. Logan

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for, But I'll make due, and its all I can afford right now. Not worth the frustration to send it back. The interior compartment walls were not properly fastened to the body wall. The exterior is peeling near the corners on the bottom. I won't be gigging or air transporting with this case, so I'm not completely freaked out by the flaws. I certainly would not buy another of this model or manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Kent

customer_reviews.title: Fits LP and LP clones.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 1 first to try on three guitars. It fits my Agile AL-2000, my 90s Les Paul(just for comparison, but it has a case), my Kona KELP, but not my PRS Tremonti. The latter doesn't cuz the Tremonti is a thin line body. So that one,,,,idk, I'll have to get a padded bag or do more research. Update 5/22: Some of the covering came unglued at the seam. I was able to reglue it with Krazy Glue. I may take a shape gun to the seam all around at some point. It's for storage and not gigging, so its not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hawthorne

customer_reviews.title: Great case!
customer_reviews.text: First off, it'a $58 case. it's not made to be roaded, however to get to and from gigs, keep your guitar from getting dusty, and beaten up at home, this thing is great! I have expensive guitars, with expensive cases, and some of the aren't relly that much better than this case. I bought it for a Danelectro, that came with a gig bag that probably cost as much as this case. a cool Dano in a gig bag, I don't think so!! The neck pocket was a little high so I removed the two screws that hold it, made the notch a little deeper, and BAM, perfect!! You cant beat it for the Doe re me. Gman, Austin, Texas
customer_reviews.author: Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Decent Case, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Does what it's supposed to, however I do have a couple of notes. 1. Even though I am using a 7 string Agile Pro Interceptor guitar, the guitar at the neck likes to slide around during transit. It hasn't been damaged yet, so fingers crossed. It's hard finding a good case that fits my guitar's dimensions, so that's why I've decided to stick with it. 2. The exterior has a cheap plastic-like coating which will chip off with moderate pressure. The case bumped into a corner or something in my car and chipped off a small piece of the plastic, exposing the wood beneath it.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: I have a Fender Jaguar. The body fits very ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a Fender Jaguar. The body fits very snug, but still fits. And the neck has about an inch left from the top. The lid fits well and it isn't putting odd pressure on anything. Obviously there are nicer cases out there, but this one does what you need it to and will get the job done
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Guitar Case at Great Price
customer_reviews.text: This is the second ChromaCast hard guitar case that I have purchased and I like both of them! I needed a hard case for my Schecter OMEN-6 guitar. I find myself playing this guitar more and more. I had bought a Schecter hard guitar case from Amazon Warehouse Deals but it didn't fit my guitar (the description said it would). I emailed ChromaCast and they said the CC-EHC case would work. It's a really nice case! It's a good value for the price. I saw the bad reviews for this guitar case and I can tell you that have not had a problem with either one of my cases.
customer_reviews.author: JohnMJam

customer_reviews.title: great case for the money
customer_reviews.text: I just don't get it... great case for the money... except the handle is... hey guys here's an idea, instead of in the middle let's put the handle... on the... bottom. It's pretty bad, compared to your store bought cases you'll see it's moved like half a foot back. Means the case is constantly bumping the ground and awkward to carry. I really don't know why they moved the handle further from middle than conventional cases.
customer_reviews.author: sceprent

customer_reviews.title: Does what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.text: I only use cases to store when doing household moves or the occasional need to store away when doing things like house remodeling, so I can't vouch for working musician road-worthiness. But for general household use, personal car travel, or home/job relocation via movers, it is very very adequate. Not sure I'd trust it to the airlines.
customer_reviews.author: Headhunter 6

customer_reviews.title: Great case for shipping
customer_reviews.text: I needed to ship a guitar via UPS air mail and this case was great. Detuned the strings, padded around the instrument so it couldn't move around at all. Since it came with a cardboard box, I just repacked it in the same box and away it went! Arrived at its destination safe and sound. Couldn't ask for more, or a better price.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Beware no refunds no returns !
customer_reviews.text: I sent this case back it did not fit. Took it to UPS as instructed. The case went somewhere. Same with my money it's gone also. This is the only avenue , Amazon no answer a phone. Pity
customer_reviews.author: jm

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal For The Price......
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for.....great case. Not the Hardest Shell out there, but good enough for what I needed it for. I use 3 cases (Soft, this one & extra Hard Shell) for different occasions, depends with my Travels. Wouldn't reco Checking your Instrument at the Airport with this case, that's what I'm trying to say here basically. I Will tell you this one is used the most with me & I really have nothing negative to report. It's doing its job. And for the Price, Def worth every penny ! I Reco for light to medium travels.
customer_reviews.author: JRiz

customer_reviews.title: Measurements Are Wrong On Mine
customer_reviews.text: The measurements on the one I received were short and I couldn't close the case properly. The fit was really too tight at the lower bout and not deep enough. The Measurements on Mine are: 16 3/8 " lower bout 13 1/4 " upper bout 4 3/4" high Too much trouble to return - sell it on CL
customer_reviews.author: AllenK

customer_reviews.title: Nice case but storage compartment is located in bad spot and wasn't pictured that way in the listing
customer_reviews.text: The case itself looks nice but when I ordered it the pictures showed the pull tab for the storage compartment on the side, not the middle. The problem with this is that the tab and it's metal piece that holds it down is right under the neck of my guitar which is not good at all. The manufacturer changed the location but the product pictures were the same, I wouldn't have purchased it if I saw this
customer_reviews.author: Pamela J

customer_reviews.title: Great case...great protection!
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this affordable Bass guitar case is great. I was pleased with the locks, the hinges, and the overall construction. The handle is slightly offset to account for the heavier body vs the neck. The storage area also easily holds picks, pens or pencils, markers, and other small parts as needed. .
customer_reviews.author: T. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: JM snug as a bug.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with the quality of this case. Bang for the buck factor is a ten and it fit my jm copy perfectly, which measures an astounding 40.75 inches from the bottom strap button to the tip of the head stock. Fit and finish of the case is excellent and the interior's plush lining will provide all the protection needed if I decide to take the jm out of the house. I will be ordering a second case very soon for the other jm that I recently finished building. Excellent!!
customer_reviews.author: stephen alston

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made. Could damage your guitar.
customer_reviews.text: I ended up returning this case and buying one at my local guitar shop. The outside of the case seems durable enough; however, the inside lacked sufficient padding. It held my guitar at an odd angle, with the neck slanted upward. This caused the lid to place pressure on the headstock. I feared that over time, this could lead to warping of the neck. To be fair, it may also be the type of guitar, as I was housing an Agile Septor 727. So this case may very well work for other types of guitars. But it did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my Guild F250 Jumbo. It arrived in a few days and was packed well. Only small dislike is the inner storage box lid is a bit flimsy. But nothing else. Tolex looks good, it has 5 latches and fits my Jumbo perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Schickie

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, terrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. It is complete junk and only good if u intend to leave the guitar sitting in it without ever transporting. It is made of styrofoam and screws to support the middle of the case. The middle won’t even latch because the screw pulled out of the styrofoam during shipping. If you value your guitar buy a decent case, this isn’t it.
customer_reviews.author: Jtsfu

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I am a rhythm guitarist/lead vocalist that has been playing the local scene and surrounding areas for about 30 years, and have been through a few cases acoustic and electric. This case is built just as well as the old case for my Martin, and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. Very sturdy and well-padded.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Lott

customer_reviews.title: The inside is nice but the outside already had Rolex coming up from ...
customer_reviews.text: The inside is nice but the outside already had tolex coming up from the sides. It fits all styles of guitar which is nice but I am unimpressed by the outside of the case. It seems fairly sturdy but time will tell. I wish I could find a fender hard case that fit my other guitars as well because I would have bought one of those. This case does the job but there's a reason it's so cheap
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Heilig

customer_reviews.title: Fits Epiphone EJ-200SCE snugly and securely!
customer_reviews.text: I was blown away by the quality of this case, especially considering that it is half the price of the next cheapest hard shell case. It has 5 latches, and the outside has some nice looking stitching around the case. I have a Road Runner dreadnought case that i paid twice as much for and it doesn’t look or feel as nice as the Chromacast. Next time I get a new guitar (when my wife ain’t looking) I’ll get a chromacast case for it as well!
customer_reviews.author: shinesmith

customer_reviews.title: Super simple guitar case
customer_reviews.text: This case is good, but don't expect it to hold anything more than your guitar. It is as simple as it can get, and it serves as a sturdy case offering more protection than a gig bag. One other thing is that it still smells like it came right out of a factory. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Donolli

customer_reviews.title: Awesome case for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for a Jasmin s35 acoustic guitar. It seems very durable and has held up great. The latches dont seem to be the very best ones out there, but for the price, they do just fine. Its great that it comes with a lock and 2 keys. You can leave it around a family reunion and not worry about the kids getting to it and opening it up. The inside has a nice compartment where I store extra strings, a capo, string winder tool, action gauge, one set of keys and still has plenty of space more more stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Ram9

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this case for my pheasant fans (burlesque) as ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this case for my pheasant fans (burlesque) as the fans are 37" tall and I wasn't able to find a hard case for fans. This case was a pleasant surprise! It came in 2 days and did not have any damage to the case. The case is well insulated/lined and includes keys for the lock, which I haven't used yet. It is a lot heavier than I expected it gives me peace of mind that my fans wont be damaged when travelling.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great bargain case!
customer_reviews.text: Nice cheap case. Fits my Ibanez RG-series just fine. It has a little bit of play in the case, but not enough to matter. I probably wouldn't use this case for this guitar if I was a touring or regularly performing musician, but it works great for home storing my guitar that I pull out once a month. Would not use this case to carry an expensive super-sweet fancy custom axe. This is not heavy-duty by any means. It is light weight and quite suitable for light use.
customer_reviews.author: mirkwoodsman

customer_reviews.title: Good study case and the price is right.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a case for my mate's Italian banjo. It turns out that his banjo is thicker through the body than most American made ones. It was leaning up against my guitar case. And then it came to me. Banjo fit inside with no muss or fuss. The case is nicer than my old guitar case so I have ordered a second one for my guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent case, considering the price. Certainly equivalent in quality to the cheap hard cases that GC puts on sale all the time. I returned it because it was just too long for my short scale bass. I was looking for a better fit for my Gretsch Electromatic G2220 (I found the perfect case, by the way--the Gator GC-ELEC-XL, yep, the "extra-long" guitar case. Fits my Gretsch like a GLOVE!)
customer_reviews.author: azfatboy

customer_reviews.title: It's good for the money, but the lock is subpart.
customer_reviews.text: Got the Pro Tele/Strat version. It's a good case for the price. Telecaster fits in it very snug and the two compartments are useful. I put my picks, capo, strap and extra strings in one and tools (string stretcher, string cutters, screwdriver, wrenches for saddles and truss rod) in the other. Only drawback was the piss poor lock. I got one good use out of it, testing it out, and upon unlocking it, broke the pin off that the key catches to activate to mechanism. The padding is nice on mine. No ripping on the outside as in other reviews. I took a chance and, other than the lock, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Goss

customer_reviews.title: Way too small.
customer_reviews.text: I just received this and the size is wrong. I ordered an acoustic dreadnought size and it was way too small for any of my dreadnaughts, it was even too small for my concert size guitar. The only guitar that I had that was small enough to fit was my Yamaha FG-75. I will be keeping the case because it fits the FG-75 like a glove, but I’m only giving 3 stars because the size was way too small for any of my guitars that are actually dreadnaughts.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Schmidtke

customer_reviews.title: I'm Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting anything super great; but I am very impressed with this $60 case! My Strat fits very well and the storage cubby is more an adiwuste for straps, strings - whatever. Don't hesitate on buying this case. For keeping dust and bumps off your guitar (home use, car travel) it's great!
customer_reviews.author: MS1954

customer_reviews.title: Jumbo Guitar Case
customer_reviews.text: This is the case I have been seeking for my 17" archtop guitar. Well made, looks like the original case. I had purchased a molded case from another supplier that was twice as expensive, so I returned it. Would highly recommend if you are trying to find an archtop guitar case that fits 17" lower bout.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Budget Bass Case.
customer_reviews.text: Okay for the price I wasn't expecting this Bass Case to be that good, however I have to admit that this is a good Case for the price of it and if you need a Case for your Bass this is a more than fair price Case and I highly recommend getting it , because it's a lot better than a bag Case only problem I had with it the locks not very good .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: I am blown away by the quality of this case. Around the time I purchased it, I also purchased 2 so-called "deluxe" cases from other manufacturers. Each of those cost about 3 times the price of the ChromaCast case, and the quality didn't come anywhere close! The attention to detail and the sturdiness of the ChromaCast case are amazing. It just goes to show that this company put a lot of thought and care into the product despite the low price. I know that every element of the case, inside and out, will keep my guitar safe and clean for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Electriclady22

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for a vintage arch top acoustic guitar
customer_reviews.text: I needed something more durable and protective than the original case for a 1930's acoustic archtop guitar. This case seems quite well made and fits quite well with a little space all around. I am very happy with it, especially for the reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: E. Beck

customer_reviews.title: You won't get a full refund if you need to send the case back!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this case for my es175 which is an LP style guitar. It didn't fit. I sent it back and did not receive a full refund. I paid $69 and received a $49.00 refund. The case is nice. I'm not complaining about that. It's the $20 they kept without explanation that bothers me.
customer_reviews.author: David W Stone Sr

customer_reviews.title: Your Fender will ACTUALLY FIT!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a case and was drawn to the internal storage capacity (strings, batteries, cables, etc.) but the instrument body portion was an inch TOO SHORT for a standard Precision or Jazz bass design. So I went with fit, instead of storage on the replacement case...ChromaCast for the Win.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B.

customer_reviews.title: Good seller,  but stay away from this guitar case.
customer_reviews.text: The seller shipped this item promptly, but I'm very disappointed with the item itself. These pics were taken immediately after I removed the case from the box. As you can see, an exterior screw was already loose. Even worse, an interior piece that stabilizes the guitar neck arrived broken. And the lining was bubbling, for some reason. My fault for going with an inexpensive guitar case; I learned my lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Geezer

customer_reviews.title: A good case for the price!
customer_reviews.text: The only reason for a 4 star overall is because of the handle hardware. One of the metal anchors for the handle jiggles and is somewhat loose. The metal is thin, and the plating is so so. But the case has ample padding inside, and the outside looks more expensive than it is.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: The cheapest hard case you can find
customer_reviews.text: This is the cheapest hard shell case you will find. It is adequate for any acoustic guitar. I am pleased with my purchase. The case did come with a big dent on the edge, but it’s not worth shipping it back on that account. I recommend this purchase if you need a quick case and don’t want to spend a lot.
customer_reviews.author: ZoonVanDeKoning

customer_reviews.title: the case flexes more than I'd really like, the fit of my bass in the case ...
customer_reviews.text: It works, the case flexes more than I'd really like, the fit of my bass in the case isn't perfect (Ibanez Talman bass) and the hardware is obviously not very expensive, but for the price it definitely works and I'm not disappointed with the purchase. When it comes to instrument cases you definitely get what you pay for, and while I almost certainly wouldn't let this get put into the luggage compartment of a plane, it works well enough for loading up into my car for local gigs.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Washburn

customer_reviews.title: Just Great
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the value on this item. I looked at a lot of les paul style cases before choosing this one and I'm happy I did. Great quality for the money. The texture of the inside feels nice and soft with a very protective hardshell on the outside to keep your guitar safe. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations
customer_reviews.text: The fitment is like a glove, very snug and supportive of my custom T-style. I've never had a hard case for an electric before so I don't have anything else to compare it to based on experience, but I would more than likely buy this case again instead of 50-100% more money for a genuine Fender.
customer_reviews.author: JChap1590

customer_reviews.title: Jazzmaster Fits
customer_reviews.text: If looking for a decent case for a Jazzmaster this case works. A jazzmaster is a little longer than a Stratacaster and most cases won't work for one in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: Duie

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice, solid piece. Haven't gone to practice with it. But it fits my bass and isn't hard to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Stuart Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Finest Guitar Case I own
customer_reviews.text: I have a red Epiphone Special otherwise known as a Les Paul. I bought the guitar used for $60. I bought the LP case and it fits perfectly. I also have two Telecasters and two Stratocasters and four Fender cases. The quality of the hardware, outside finish and lining is top quality. The ChromaCast LP case is one of the finest cases I own and at an excellent price. If I buy another Fender I'll save a buck and but a Chromacast Case!
customer_reviews.author: Silicon Valley VP

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CASE AT A GREAT PRICE!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure what to expect in such a reasonably priced case, but when I received it, I was pleasantly surprised at how good it looked, and how well made it was. In fact, at first I thought I must have received the wrong case. The interior padding is excellent, and will definitely provide the protection I was looking for. My Yamaha acoustic fits like it was custom made, and the storage area is really handy and sufficient for my tuner, capo, strings, picks, and more. All around, I'm convinced that I could not have done better.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Kase

customer_reviews.title: Not safe for Gibson Les Pauls
customer_reviews.text: This case arrived on time, looks good and can fit any number of guitars with a compartment for some gear. Only gripe is that the neck support is not high enough to accommodate the Gibson Les Paul I got it for. Because of the headstock angle, the guitar will rest in the case on the top of the headstock and the bottom of the body without resting in the divot. This is a easy recipe for a broken headstock. A slightly thinner guitar like my Gibson SG fits in the divot ok and doesn’t have this problem since the body doesn’t hold it off as high. Good cheap case, just be careful what you put in it.
customer_reviews.author: Rj

customer_reviews.title: Uh, no ...
customer_reviews.text: Fine looking and built case, however, there is just a very shallow divot cut for the neck to rest on, which causes the neck to angle upward, inside the case. When you close it, the top of the case presses down on the headstock, so, you effectively have the neck serving as a fulcrum, with torque pressing the headstock downward, thereby putting backward pressure on the neck. Not something I want to worry about, so I returned it immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Carsello

customer_reviews.title: Great for money
customer_reviews.text: Amazed at case for money. Especially for a Strat. I wish the locks were tighter a lil loose feeling, but can be fixed easily by cutting up a wide rubber band and gluing it so it’s a tighter fit. But traveled with it as is and didn’t have a problem.
customer_reviews.author: ReptilianAlien

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome guitar case
customer_reviews.text: I would say this is one of the best and affordable guitar cases out there. I placed my guitar in this case and walked around. Because of this case I ended up with 10 phone numbers from beautiful women. Getting those phone numbers for you is no guarantee but for me I was #Blessed. I am thankful for this case. Not only does it protect my guitar efficiently but I am also with many wives because of it
customer_reviews.author: Dookie Lumpkins

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son. Right off the bat, the lock does not work! Pointless having one on there. Second the material scratches easily. It does have good storage and it has a nice liner. Closest smooth and hinges are good. Over all would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Hampton

customer_reviews.title: A Little Roomy For Ibanez Bass, But Overall Great Hard Case
customer_reviews.text: The case itself is really nicely made. My Ibanez style bass sits a little (not much) loose inside the case, but I just placed an old black cotton t-shirt on top where the neck rests inside the case, and my bass doesn't move at all inside. Honestly, for the price I don't think you will find a nicer case. Hope this review helps someone.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great case at an ever better price point.
customer_reviews.text: Fits either of the Mitchell electric guitars I have very well. MD400 (PRS-ish) & HD400 (Ibanez RG-ish) No slipping around inside. Amazing deal for the price! Update: The one I purchased 3/2018 also fits baritone length guitars (27-28"scale), but this new one (9/2019) doesn't. The exterior dimensions are identical, but somehow the interior length is a few inches smaller now.
customer_reviews.author: Orville Shrednbacher

customer_reviews.title: Great Case for my Fender
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised with this case, it was much nicer then I expected. Fits my Strat perfect. I have a Fender factory case for another guitar.This case is just as good, if not better then the Fender case. Lots of room for accessories, very nice case indeed.
customer_reviews.author: L. Herren

customer_reviews.title: Needed a case for my old Kramer Focus - this works well
customer_reviews.text: I needed a case for my old Kramer Focus 6000. Guitar fits well with a weeeeee little bit of space in the body - the nexk and headstock seem fully supported. I used a tiny bit of foam at the bottom and not the guitar fits nice and snug!
customer_reviews.author: John Temprile

product_meta.title: ChromaCast CC-EHC Electric Guitar Hard Case
product_meta.description: Size:ElectricChromaCast hard cases are designed to protect your instrument and keep it sounding its best. Durable wood construction features plush lined interior with extra neck and bridge padding for full support. Sturdy chrome latches and bumpers on bottom and sides of case add protection and stability. Molded handle allows for comfortable, easy transport. Also features large accessory compartment. Designed by musicians for the active player. ChromaCast is dedicated to crafting roadworthy products. Providing the best in creative design and durability. ChromaCast proves you don't have to spend a fortune for quality music gear. Electric hard case interior dimensions: 41.5" Length, 14" Wide upper bout, 14" Wide lower bout, 3" Height.
feature_bullets: Lockable wood hard case with plush lined interior that Includes extra neck and Bridge padding
Sturdy chrome latches and bumpers on bottom and sides of case for added protection and stability
Large interior storage compartment for accessories
Interior dimensions: 41" Length, 14" Wide upper Bout, 13.25" Wide lower bout, 3" Height

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,272 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
